means: 麻烦
烦恼
故障
动乱
费心
烦恼
麻烦
使烦恼
折磨

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使人不安或烦恼"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: bother, disturb, trouble, annoy, irritate, vex
means: bother ： 指使人烦恼而引起的紧张不安或感到不耐烦。
disturb ： 较正式用词，多用被动态。指拢乱，使人不能平静或妨碍别人工作、思维或正常秩序，是程度较深的烦恼。
trouble ： 指给人在行动上带来不便或在身心上造成痛苦。
annoy ： 强调因被迫忍受令人不快、讨厌的事而失去平静或耐心，多指一时的打拢或恼怒。
irritate ： 语气比annoy强得多，指激怒，使发怒，多指一种短时间的反应。
vex ： 侧重指因不断的干扰而引起的烦恼，有时含激怒的意味。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均表示"努力"之意。
means: effort ： 通常指完成某特定任务所需付出的或大或小的努力，可指一次的努力，也可指坚持不懈的努力。
trouble和pains均侧重在面临困难或阻力时所作的努力，但强调在努力时的细心和谨慎，相比之下，pains更适合表示尽力的努力。
pains ：
endeavour ： 指持久的，坚持不懈的，甚至是终身的努力，强调努力的认真与决心。
struggle ： 指为克服困难或阻力所作的努力，也指因决心、意志或干劲而产生的极大努力。

sentence.Network_en: She dropped out after 20 kilometres with stomach trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 20公里后她因胃痛而退出了比赛。

sentence.Network_en: Her husband had never before had any heart trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 她丈夫以前从来没得过任何心脏疾病。

sentence.Network_en: A dentist may decide to extract the tooth to prevent recurrent trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 牙医可能会决定拔掉那颗牙，以免反复发作。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)act in a way that is likely to incur problems or difficulties

lj.lj_ly: hitching a lift is asking for trouble.
lj.lj_ls: 想免费搭便车是自找麻烦。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)behave in a way that is likely to provoke an argument or fight

lj.lj_ly: youths take a cocktail of drink and drugs before going out to look for trouble.
lj.lj_ls: 酒和毒品混用过以后，这群年轻人就出去惹是生非了。

phrase.cizu_name: a trouble shared is a trouble halved

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)talking to someone else about one's problems helps to alleviate them
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)苦恼让人知晓，负担一半减少

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French truble (noun), trubler (verb), based on Latin turbidus (see turbid)

encyclopedia.content: oh no, i see, 哦不，我明白 a spider web, it's tangled up with me, 一张蜘蛛网，它缠住了我 and i lost my head, 缠得我昏了头 the thought of all the stupid things i said, 想起所有我说过的蠢话 oh no what's this? 哦不，这是什么？ a spider web, and i'm caught in the middle, 一张蜘蛛网，我被困在中间 oh i turned to run, 哦我转身跑开 the thought of all the stupid things i've done, 想起所有我做过的蠢事 and

entry.def: You can refer to problems or difficulties as trouble .

example.ex: I had trouble parking...
example.tran: 我停车有困难。

example.ex: You've caused us a lot of trouble...
example.tran: 你给我们造成了很多麻烦。

entry.tran: 麻烦;问题;引起麻烦的事
entry.def: If you say that one aspect of a situation is the trouble, you mean that it is the aspect which is causing problems or making the situation unsatisfactory.

example.ex: The trouble is that these restrictions have remained while other things have changed...
example.tran: 问题是其他事情都变了，而这些条条框框还在。

example.ex: Your trouble is that you can't take rejection.
example.tran: 你的问题是不能接受拒绝。

entry.def: Your troubles are the things that you are worried about.

example.ex: She tells me her troubles. I tell her mine…
example.tran: 我和她互相倾诉烦恼。

example.ex: She kept her troubles to herself.
example.tran: 她把烦心事都放在心里。

entry.def: If you have kidney trouble or back trouble, for example, there is something wrong with your kidneys or your back.

example.ex: An unsuitable bed is the most likely cause of back trouble…
example.tran: 不合适的床最有可能引起背部疼痛。

example.ex: Her husband had never before had any heart trouble...
example.tran: 她丈夫以前从来没得过任何心脏疾病。

entry.def: If there is trouble somewhere, especially in a public place, there is fighting or rioting there.

example.ex: Riot police are being deployed throughout the city to prevent any trouble...
example.tran: 正在全城部署防暴警察以防止发生骚乱。

example.ex: Fans who make trouble during the World Cup will be severely dealt with.
example.tran: 在世界杯期间闹事的球迷将受到严惩。

entry.def: If you tell someone that it is no trouble to do something for them, you are saying politely that you can or will do it, because it is easy or convenient for you.

example.ex: It's no trouble at all; on the contrary, it will be a great pleasure to help you...
example.tran: 根本不费事，恰恰相反，非常荣幸能帮到你。

example.ex: Will it be any trouble to get over here that quickly?
example.tran: 那么快来这里会不会有什么不便？

entry.tran: 需劳神费力的人(或动物)
entry.def: If you say that a person or animal is no trouble, you mean that they are very easy to look after.

example.ex: My little grandson is no trouble at all, but his 6-year-old elder sister is rude and selfish.
example.tran: 我的小孙子一点都不让人操心，但是他6岁大的姐姐却野蛮而又自私。

entry.def: If something troubles you, it makes you feel rather worried.

example.ex: Is anything troubling you?...
example.tran: 有什么事情让你烦恼吗？

example.ex: He was troubled by the lifestyle of his son.
example.tran: 他对儿子的生活方式感到很担心。

entry.def: If a part of your body troubles you, it causes you physical pain or discomfort.

example.ex: The ulcer had been troubling her for several years.
example.tran: 溃疡已经折磨她好几年了。

entry.def: If you say that someone does not trouble to do something, you are critical of them because they do not behave in the way that they should do, and you think that this would require very little effort.

example.ex: He yawns, not troubling to cover his mouth...
example.tran: 他打了个哈欠，都懒得抬抬手遮一下嘴巴。

example.ex: He hadn't troubled himself to check his mirrors...
example.tran: 他都没想要看看后视镜。

entry.def: You use trouble in expressions such as I'm sorry to trouble you when you are apologizing to someone for disturbing them in order to ask them something.

example.ex: I'm sorry to trouble you, but I wondered if by any chance you know where he is...
example.tran: 对不起打扰了，但我想打听一下您是否知道他在哪里。

example.ex: I hate to trouble you, but Aunt Lina's birthday is coming up and I would like to buy something nice for her.
example.tran: 我真不愿打扰您，但莉娜阿姨的生日就要到了，我想给她买点好东西。

entry.tran: 处于困境;惹麻烦;将受惩罚
entry.def: If someone is in trouble, they are in a situation in which a person in authority is angry with them or is likely to punish them because they have done something wrong.

example.ex: He was in trouble with his teachers...
example.tran: 老师们都想好好教训他。

example.ex: The person who loaned them to me got into terrible trouble for it.
example.tran: 把那笔钱借给我的那个人因此倒霉了。

entry.def: If you take the trouble to do something, you do something which requires a small amount of additional effort.

example.ex: It is worth taking the trouble to sieve the fruit by hand…
example.tran: 值得费点劲用手挑挑果子。

example.ex: He did not take the trouble to see the film before he attacked it.
example.tran: 他在批评那部电影之前都懒得费神欣赏。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is more trouble than they are worth, you mean that they cause you a lot of problems or take a lot of time and effort and you do not achieve or gain very much in return.

example.ex: Some grumbled that Johnson was more trouble than he was worth...
example.tran: 有人抱怨说根本不值得为约翰逊浪费精力。

example.ex: Learning more about it always seemed more trouble than it was worth.
example.tran: 似乎总是觉得没必要为进一步了解它而大费工夫。

sentences.sentence: "one trouble after another delayed the job"
"he didn't want to make a fuss"

means.word_mean: 3. an event causing distress or pain;

sentences.sentence: "I went to a lot of trouble"
"finished the test only with great difficulty"
"his worry over the prospect of being fired"
"it is not work but worry that kills"
"he wanted to die and end his troubles"

means.word_mean: 2. to cause inconvenience or discomfort to;
3. disturb in mind or make uneasy or cause to be worried or alarmed;

sentences.sentence: "She was rather perturbed by the news that her father was seriously ill"

means.word_mean: 4. take the trouble to do something; concern oneself;

sentences.sentence: "He did not trouble to call his mother on her birthday"

auth_sentence.content: More trouble between Israel and the Palestinians is overdue.
auth_sentence.res_content: More trouble between Israel and the Palestinians is overdue.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: More trouble between Israel and the Palestinians is overdue.

auth_sentence.content: Mind you, Sky remotes are right trouble makers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mind you, Sky remotes are right trouble makers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mind you, Sky remotes are right trouble makers.

auth_sentence.content: But it may have more trouble converting the doubters.
auth_sentence.res_content: But it may have more trouble converting the doubters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But it may have more trouble converting the doubters.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 麻烦的, 讨厌的, 棘手的
stems_affixes.word_buile: trouble烦恼+some表形容词→adj.麻烦的, 讨厌的, 棘手的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 烦恼, 麻烦, 动乱
stems_affixes.word_buile: troub搅动,混乱+le表示反复动作→n.&v.烦恼, 麻烦, 动乱

Sentence.sentence: Before the internet, renting a surfboard, a power tool or a parking space from someone else was feasible, but was usually more trouble than it was worth
In the initial stage, the current economic crisis is likely to tear many troubled families apart.
But this vote of confidence in Oprah sends a troubling message at precisely the time when American universities need to do more to advance the cause of reason.

But at a time when the American factory seems to be a shrinking presence, and when good manufacturing jobs have vanished, perhaps never to return, there is something deeply troubling about this dilution of American craftsmanship.
He felt troubled about the weakening of American craftsmanship.

means.word_mean: 困难, 忧虑, 麻烦

sentences.en: The old lady told me all her troubles.
sentences.cn: 这个老太太把她的烦恼都告诉了我。

sentences.en: He has been through much trouble.
The new company did well at first, but then ran into trouble.
sentences.cn: 这家新公司最初办得还不错, 但后来就陷入困境了。

sentences.en: The trouble is that he doesn't have enough money.
She had no hand in this trouble.
The car's got some sort of engine trouble again.
sentences.cn: 车子的引擎又出了什么故障。

sentences.en: I mustn't trouble if he doesn't come tonight.
sentences.cn: 今晚他若不来, 我就不用费心劳神了。

sentences.en: Please don't trouble to see me off at the station.
sentences.cn: 请不用麻烦到车站送我了。

sentences.en: I don't wish to trouble them.
What troubles me is that the supply of raw materials is not ensured.
sentences.cn: 使我担忧的是原料供应没有保证。

sentences.en: May I trouble you to shut the door?

jushi.english: Owing to engine trouble, the plane had to make a forced landing.
jushi.chinese: 由于发动机出了毛病,飞机不得不进行迫降。

jushi.english: The trouble with you is that you don't listen carefully!
jushi.chinese: 你的缺点是不好好听讲。

jushi.english: The trouble started when the police tried to break up the demonstration.
jushi.chinese: 警察企图驱散示威人群时爆发了骚乱。
